title: Section Object Validation
description: Validation schema for section objects. A section at Cal Poly is a specific instance of a class. Occasionally, a section could meet in different rooms/at different times depending on the day or in multiple locations on the same day, this could result in multiple section objects for the same section.

_id.description: the unique identifier for the section object

term_id.description: the term id associated with the section

college_id.description: the college id associated with the section

subject_id.description: the subject id associated with the section

course_id.description: the course id associated with the section

alias.description: the section's alias; includes the course code and section number (ex. 'CSC-582-01', 'CSC-582-02')

requirement_code.description: the requirement code associated with the section, if one exists (code representing a set of requirements for the course)

requirement_message.description: the requirement message associated with the section, if one exists (explains what is required to take this course)

days.description: a code for the days of the week the section meets, if available (ex. 'MWF', 'TR'; letters generally ordered by day of the week)

start.description: the start time of the section, if available (ex. '04:10 PM', '10:40 AM')

end.description: the end time of the section, if available (ex. '05:00 PM', '11:40 AM')

instructor_id.description: the id of the instructor who teaches the section, if available

room_id.description: the id of the room where the section meets, if available

enrollment_capacity.description: the maximum number of students that can enroll in the section, if available

enrolled.description: the number of students enrolled in the section, if available

waitlisted.description: the number of students waitlisted for the section, if available

ics_download_url.description: the url to download the section's calendar file in .ics format, if available (useful for end users)

url.description: the url to the section's page (useful for end users)
